description:
Since the 1980s, modern states have become increasingly squeamish about infringing the 'human rights' of violent criminals, even at the expense of their own populations. Why is that, asks Dr David McGrogan.

The post Why Does the Modern State Have More Compassion for Murderers Than its Own Population? appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Why Does the Modern State Have More Compassion for Murderers Than its Own Population?

description:
Humza Yousaf has received more complaints under Scotland's new hate crime bill for his 2020 speech about "often being the only non-white person in the room" than J.K. Rowling, it was claimed today.

The post “More Complaints” About Humza Yousaf’s 2020 Speech About “Often Being the Only Non-White Person in the Room” Than J.K. Rowling Under New Hate Crime Law as Police Receive 4,000 Complaints in Two Days appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: “More Complaints” About Humza Yousaf’s 2020 Speech About “Often Being the Only Non-White Person in the Room” Than J.K. Rowling Under New Hate Crime Law as Police Receive 4,000 Complaints in Two Days

description:
Imagine a risk-free business scheme in which you get to create the market, manage its regulation, then confine people to their homes until they buy it. Welcome to the WHO's world of pandemic management, says Dr David Bell.

The post Pandemics: A Business Opportunity appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Pandemics: A Business Opportunity

description:
Every job in wind and solar power is currently costing the taxpayer over £250,000 in subsidies every year. This isn't the promised "green prosperity"; it's the path to penury.

The post Revealed: Renewable Energy Jobs Are Being Subsidised by £250,000 Each, Every Year appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Revealed: Renewable Energy Jobs Are Being Subsidised by £250,000 Each, Every Year

description:
Will people waving their arms around and making strange noises in public really help dismantle anti-autistic prejudice, or just make them look like they are mocking the disabled, asks Steven Tucker.

The post Will People Waving Their Arms Around and Making Strange Noises in Public Really Help Dismantle Anti-Autistic Prejudice, or Just Make Them Look Like They Are Mocking the Disabled? appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Will People Waving Their Arms Around and Making Strange Noises in Public Really Help Dismantle Anti-Autistic Prejudice, or Just Make Them Look Like They Are Mocking the Disabled?

description:
For years, McKinsey has been promoting the "business case for diversity". But a new paper shows that it's built on sand: S&P 500 companies with more 'executive diversity' perform no better than those with less.

The post There’s No ‘Business Case’ for Diversity appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: There’s No ‘Business Case’ for Diversity

description:
In the latest episode of the Weekly Sceptic, the talking points are J.K. Rowling's heroic defiance of Police Scotland, the civil war on the Right likely to follow a Tory defeat and Team GB's desecration of the Union Jack.

The post Nick Dixon and Toby Young Talk About J.K. Rowling’s Heroic Defiance of Police Scotland, the Coming Civil War on the Right and the Desecration of Yet Another British Flag appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Nick Dixon and Toby Young Talk About J.K. Rowling’s Heroic Defiance of Police Scotland, the Coming Civil War on the Right and the Desecration of Yet Another British Flag
